titles.title: Unemployed Workers Hiring Act of 2011
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide payroll tax relief to encourage the hiring of unemployed individuals, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 9/8/2011--Introduced. Unemployed Workers Hiring Act of 2011 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to exempt employers and employees from employment taxes for up to one year for wages paid to new employees who had exhausted all unemployment benefits prior to the start of their employment and who are working on average at least 30 hours a week.
